2020.summary: In a year-long study, a professor investigated the effectiveness of various measures in combating COVID-19 across 18 countries and regions. Utilizing explainable AI techniques, the research revealed that city lockdowns, contact tracing, and wearing face masks were the most effective strategies. However, the study also found that mass testing alone did not yield significant results in curbing the spread of the virus.

intermediate_results.https://scholar.google.com/citations?vie: The research article investigates the effectiveness of different measures implemented to combat COVID-19 in 18 countries and regions, using explainable AI techniques. The study finds that city lockdown, contact tracing, and wearing face masks are the most effective measures, while mass testing alone is not as effective.

2021.summary: The professor's research focuses on the application of explainable AI algorithms in various domains, including cognitive inhibition in older adults, classification accuracy, COVID-19 interventions and economic support policies, machine learning underspecification, and virtual reality as a rehabilitation platform for elderly individuals. Their findings provide valuable insights for policymakers and practitioners in these areas, contributing to the advancement of research and potential benefits for the respective populations.

intermediate_results.https://scholar.google.com/citations?vie: The Ping Pong exergame was designed to improve cognitive inhibition in older adults and was found to be effective in a longitudinal study.

This research article evaluates the correctness of explainable AI algorithms for classification by creating datasets with known explanation ground truth and shows that SHAP provides more accurate explanations than LIME.

This research article investigates the impact of COVID-19 non-pharmaceutical interventions and economic support policies on foreign exchange markets using explainable AI techniques, providing insights for governments and policymakers.
This research article explores the concept of machine learning underspecification by using feature attribution algorithms to identify it, with a case study on COVID-19 virus transmission.
This research article explores the use of virtual reality as a rehabilitation platform for psychosocially impaired elderly individuals to regain necessary skills for independent community living.

2022.summary: Professor X has made significant contributions to the field of feature attribution in large datasets with the development of CAFA, an algorithm that accurately calculates the relative importance of controllable factors. By excluding influences from uncontrollable features while preserving the predictive power of the dataset, CAFA provides users with a deeper understanding of the underlying factors driving outcomes.

intermediate_results.https://scholar.google.com/citations?vie: This research article proposes a feature attribution algorithm called CAFA, which allows users to understand the influence of controllable factors in large datasets by calculating their relative importance. The experiments conducted show that CAFA can exclude influences from uncontrollable features while maintaining the full dataset for prediction.
